info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 4:31PM EDT until May 13 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN ALLEGANY COUNTY...
At 431 PM EDT, Emergency management reported widespread flash flooding in Westernport, Luke, and Barton. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall rates up to 1 inch are expected through late this afternoon.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Westernport, Luke, and Barton. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. The water level on Georges Creek at Westernport has surpassed major flood stage of 12 feet and appears to be cresting. At this level, numerous buildings and roads in the town of Westernport and points upstream are flooded; water reaches both railroad bridges upstream of Westernport, as well as multiple bridges in Westernport.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Westernport... Lonaconing... Piedmont... Barton... Franklin... Luke... Dogwood Flats... Reynolds...
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR WESTERNPORT, LUKE, AND BARTON
